Description: Neck and shoulder fragment of Attic, probably black-figured, one-piece pottery amphora. Neck glazed with red line at base; below palmette-lotus chain in silhouette.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 73, no. 239 pl. 53)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0906)
